abstracts.cdata!:
The Private Sector Development Credit
            Project will support the structural measures needed to
            accelerate the development of the private sector, strengthen
            the financial sector, and promote growth notably in two
            sectors where private sector activity is promising: fishing
            and mining. The credit will support a program of policy
            reforms which are necessary for establishing an environment
            conducive to supply-response and self-sustained growth of
            the private sector. The reform program includes: (i)
            unification of foreign exchange rates; (ii) strengthening
            the legal and judiciary environment through, inter alia, the
            revision of legal codes pertaining to business and the
            training of judges and lawyers; (iii) reorganizing the
            accounting and audit profession, strengthening the minimum
            requirements for qualification and revising the accounting
            plan; (iv) empowering the Chamber of Commerce and
            strengthening it so it can represent private sector interest
            vis-a-vis the authorities and help provide needed services;
            (v) adopting and continuously enforcing new Banking Law to
            ensure sound banking practices are applied; (vi) continuing
            the regular issue of Treasury bills and the movement to
            indirect instruments of monetary control; (viii) formulation
            of a strategy for the second phase of financial sector
            development; (ix) strengthening the surveillance of fishing
            activities; (x) strengthening supervisory and research
            institutions in the fishing sector; (xi) disengaging the
            State form production and marketing of fishing activities;
            and (xii) strengthening the framework for mining sector
            development, including the revision of the mining code and
            taxation applied to mining, reorganization and strengthening
            of supervisory and regulatory institutions, and revision of
            cadastral procedures.
